summary: This document is a chain of emails between U.S. Department of Justice officials in London and New York, discussing a news article about Prince Andrew's lack of cooperation with the Epstein investigation causing diplomatic strain. It also includes internal discussion about a Mutual Legal Assistance (MLA) request related to a witness (likely Virginia Giuffre) and the status of the Ghislaine Maxwell case.

persons.name: Prince Andrew
persons.role: Duke of York, subject of investigation
persons.context: The central figure whose refusal to cooperate with U.S. investigators into Jeffrey Epstein's network is described as causing diplomatic strain between the UK and U.S. He is accused in a civil lawsuit of sexual abuse.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Deceased financier whose network and abuse of young women and girls is under investigation. His death in 2019 is mentioned.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Awaiting trial on sex trafficking charges. Her prosecution is mentioned as adding strain to UK-US relations alongside the Prince Andrew issue.

persons.name: Geoffrey Berman
persons.context: Previously stated that U.S. authorities had received "zero cooperation" from Prince Andrew regarding the Epstein investigation.

persons.name: David Boies
persons.context: Representing the accuser in the civil suit against Prince Andrew. He accused the prince of "stonewalling" appeals for information.

persons.name: The Queen
persons.context: Mentioned as the person Prince Andrew was facing after arriving at Balmoral, providing context of his royal status.

connections.description: Prince Andrew visited Epstein in multiple locations, and investigators are seeking details of these trips to understand his ties to Epstein's orbit.
Described as Epstein's former girlfriend. She is facing trial for sex trafficking charges related to his network.
A civil lawsuit alleges Prince Andrew sexually abused Virginia Giuffre, who claims she was "lent out for sexual purposes" by Epstein.
David Boies is the lawyer representing Virginia Giuffre in her civil case against Prince Andrew.

events.title: Epstein's Death
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein died in a Manhattan prison; his death was ruled a suicide.

events.title: DOJ MLA Request for Prince Andrew
events.description: The U.S. Department of Justice made an application under the US-UK mutual legal assistance treaty to secure cooperation from Prince Andrew.

events.title: Civil Lawsuit Filed Against Prince Andrew
events.description: A 15-page civil lawsuit was filed in New York alleging Prince Andrew sexually abused Virginia Giuffre.

events.title: Ghislaine Maxwell Trial Preparation
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell is set to go on trial for sex trafficking charges later in the year.

events.title: Prince Andrew's BBC Interview
events.description: Prince Andrew told the BBC he had not had sex with Virginia Giuffre and had no recollection of meeting her.

locations: 33 Nine Elms Lane, London SW11 7US (U.S. Embassy)
keyFacts: U.S. authorities express growing frustration over Prince Andrew's failure to cooperate with the Epstein investigation, causing diplomatic strain between the U.S. and UK.
A Mutual Legal Assistance (MLA) request was made by the DOJ to the UK to secure Prince Andrew's cooperation, but it has not been effective.
Investigators are interested in Prince Andrew's flights to visit Epstein in locations like Little St James, Florida, and New York to understand travel within Epstein's network.
A civil lawsuit alleges Prince Andrew sexually abused Virginia Giuffre, who claims she was "lent out for sexual purposes" by Epstein.
Internal DOJ emails discuss a witness's consent for information release and clarify that a recent civil case does not change the witness's status in the criminal investigation.
